question: Which of the following is true about displacement of an object?
option1: It is always equal to the distance travelled by the object
option2: It can be less than the distance travelled by the object
option3: It can be greater than the distance travelled by the object
option4: It always less than the distance travelled by the object
answer: It can be less than the distance travelled by the object
explanation: The displacement is the shortest distance between the initial and final position of an object in the given time. The displacement of an object is a vector quantity. It can be less than or equal to the distance but can never be greater than the distance travelled by that object
